Let me preface this little review by saying this: The recommendation could've just as well been an appeal not to play it.

Portal 2 is a really really good sequel to Portal 1, bringing with it the ever-charming GlaDos and introducing a new character, Wheatley. 
The puzzles are well thought-out and most of the time really intuivitve and fun to solve! I'm saying most of the time because sometimes the game introduces a new mechanic but then throws you a curveball and forces you to continue via simple momentum-based portal-movement, very elementary stuff. This compared with some boring level design made the game frustrating at parts for me.

Which brings me to the worst part of this game in my opinion: Most of Chapter 6 and 7 are bland, stretched out and neither complex puzzle-pieces nor story-furthering setpieces. 
If this game was roughly 2-3 hours shorter due to cutting out 3/4 of both Chapter 6 and 7, I would call it fantastic! The whole flow of the story and game overall get thrown out the window  so they can introduce the gel-mechanics. These are fun and I see the neccessity to introduce them in an environment that isn't stressful, but they never do anything jawdropping with it and in Chapter 8 none of the formerly introduced ideas bear fruits, using them only for the most rudamentary puzzles.

It pains me to realize the game hooked me in really strongly, just to lose me for no apparent reason in the last third.

The ending is satisfying, the soundtrack isn't obnoxious, the humour is great, the pacing is alright until it isn't.

Overall I can't bring myself to dislike this game.. but I can't love it either.
It fun and co-op is pretty good

Ох, об этой игре можно говорить о многом. Сюжет, загадки в нем, сложность уровней и т.д. 
В portal 2 понравилось абсолютно все. Также прошел не только одиночную игру но и мультиплеер.

[h1] TLDR: No Complaints At All [/h1]
[i] Portal 2 [/i] deserves the title of masterpiece and is a must play for any gamer. Both the single player campaign and multiplayer campaign will provide tons of fun!

[h1] Writing [/h1]
The game's writing is absolutely brilliant. Despite only having 3 main characters that talk, the game manages to stay funny and clever throughout the whole story. Wheatley is a fantastic FOIL to GlaDOS, and listening to Cave Johnson rant over the comms is hilarious.

[h1] Atmosphere [/h1]
[spoiler] In this game, you get to venture down into the depths of Aperture Science and learn more about their origins. [/spoiler] [i] Portal 2 [/i] does a fantastic job of keeping you both amazed and curious about Aperture Science's endeavors. Even the small things such as talking turrets, secret rooms, and the loading screen add to the atmosphere of the game. You really do feel the desolation and emptiness.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
[i] Portal 2 [/i] brings much more to the table than its predecessor. There are plenty of more features, that make the game more fun, diverse, and challenging. Another thing to mention is that the controls are simple and easy to master.

[h1] Graphics [/h1]
The graphics and game design are simple and beautiful.

[h1] Co-op [/h1]
If you have a friend (hopefully you do), then play Co-op mode with them. It's an amazing experience that will make you guys/gals think even harder than in the single player. Having those "A HA!" moments with your friends will make this a 10/10 experience.

This game is very fun and challenging if you don't have youtube on your device.

multiplayer is really fun, especially when people have their mics open for no goddamn reason.

10/10
